## KalturaPlayers

a map of player instances by player ids

Type: [Object][255]&lt;[string][256], KalturaPlayer>

## KPPlaylistOptions

Type: [Object][255]

### Properties

-   `autoContinue` **[boolean][257]** Whether to continue to the next item automatically

## KPPlaylistCountdownOptions

Type: [Object][255]

### Parameters

-   `timeToShow` **[number][258]?** When the countdown will appear (by default is towards the end)
-   `duration` **[number][258]** How match time the countdown will appear (optional, default `10`)
-   `showing` **[boolean][257]** Whether to show the countdown (optional, default `true`)

## KPPlaylistConfigObject

Type: [Object][255]

### Parameters

-   `options` **[KPPlaylistOptions][259]** The playlist options
-   `countdown` **[KPPlaylistCountdownOptions][260]** The playlist countdown config
-   `items` **[Array][261]&lt;[PlaylistItem][262]>** The playlist items

## KPPlaylistConfigObject

Type: [Object][255]

### Parameters

-   `id` **[string][256]** The playlist id
-   `metadata` **ProviderPlaylistMetadataObject** The playlist metadata
-   `options` **[KPPlaylistOptions][259]** The playlist options
-   `countdown` **[KPPlaylistCountdownOptions][260]** The playlist countdown config
-   `items` **[Array][261]&lt;[PlaylistItem][262]>** The playlist items

## KPPlaylistItemConfigObject

Type: [Object][255]

### Properties

-   `countdown` **[KPPlaylistCountdownOptions][260]?** Countdown options

## BaseRemotePlayer

**Extends FakeEventTarget**

Basic remote player.
Implements the Kaltura Player playback, ads, tracks,vr and cast APIs.
Remote players should extend this class and implement the needed API.

### Parameters

-   `name` **[string][256]** Remote player name.
-   `config` **[Object][255]** Cast configuration.
-   `remoteControl` **[RemoteControl][263]** Remote control.

### loadMedia

Loads a media to the receiver application.

#### Parameters

-   `mediaInfo` **[Object][255]** The entry media info.

Returns **[Promise][264]&lt;void>** Promise to indicate load succeed or failed.

### setMedia

Sets a media to the remote player..

#### Parameters

-   `mediaConfig` **[Object][255]** Media configuration to set.

Returns **void** 

### getMediaInfo

Gets the media Info.

Returns **[Object][255]?** The media info.

### configure

Configure the remote player

#### Parameters

-   `config` **[Object][255]** Configuration to set. (optional, default `{}`)

Returns **void** 

### ready

The remote player readiness.

Returns **[Promise][264]&lt;any>** Promise which resolved when the remote player is ready.

### load

Load the remote player.

Returns **void** 

### play

Play/resume the remote player.

Returns **void** 

### pause

Pause the remote player.

Returns **void** 

### reset

Reset the remote player.

Returns **void** 

### destroy

Destroy the remote player.

Returns **void** 

### isLive

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.isLive() // false
```

Returns **[boolean][257]** Whether the current playback is a live playback.

### isDvr

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.isDvr() // false
```

Returns **[boolean][257]** Whether the current live playback has DVR window. In case of non-live playback will return false.

### seekToLiveEdge

Seeks to the live edge.

Returns **void** 

### getStartTimeOfDvrWindow

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.getStartTimeOfDvrWindow() // 0
```

Returns **[number][258]** The start time of the DVR window.

### getTracks

#### Parameters

-   `type` **[string][256]?** Track type.

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.getTracks() // []
```

Returns **[Array][261]&lt;Track>** The remote player tracks.

### getActiveTracks

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.getTracks() // {audio: undefined, video: undefined, text: undefined}
```

Returns **[Object][255]** The remote player active tracks.

### selectTrack

Select a certain track to be active.

#### Parameters

-   `track` **Track** The track to activate.

Returns **void** 

### hideTextTrack

Hides the active text track.

Returns **void** 

### enableAdaptiveBitrate

Enables automatic adaptive bitrate switching.

Returns **void** 

### isAdaptiveBitrateEnabled

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.isAdaptiveBitrateEnabled() // true
```

Returns **[boolean][257]** Whether adaptive bitrate is enabled.

### setTextDisplaySettings

Sets the text display settings.

#### Parameters

-   `settings` **[Object][255]** Text settings.

Returns **void** 

### startCasting

Start casting.

Returns **[Promise][264]&lt;any>** A promise to indicate session is starting, or failed

### stopCasting

Stops the current cast session.

Returns **void** 

### isCasting

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.isCasting() // true
```

Returns **[boolean][257]** Whether casting is currently active.

### isCastAvailable

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.isCastAvailable() // true
```

Returns **[boolean][257]** Whether casting is available.

### getCastSession

Gets the current remote session.

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.getCastSession() // new RemoteSession('', '')
```

Returns **[RemoteSession][265]** The remote session.

### isVr

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.isVr() // false
```

Returns **[boolean][257]** Whether the current media is of VR type (360 content).

### toggleVrStereoMode

Toggles VR mode on the current content.

Returns **void** 

### isInVrStereoMode

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.isInVrStereoMode() // false
```

Returns **[boolean][257]** Whether the current content displayed in VR mode.

### ads

The remote player ads controller.

Type: [Object][255]?

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.ads // null
```

Returns **[Object][255]?** 

### textStyle

Setter.

#### Parameters

-   `style` **TextStyle** The text style to set.

Returns **void** 

### textStyle

Getter.

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.textStyle // new TextStyle()
```

Returns **TextStyle** The current text style.

### buffered

Gets the first buffered range of the remote player.

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.buffered // []
```

Returns **[Array][261]&lt;any>** First buffered range in seconds.

### currentTime

Setter.

#### Parameters

-   `to` **[number][258]** The number to set in seconds.

Returns **void** 

### currentTime

Getter.

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.currentTime // 0
```

Returns **[number][258]** The current time in seconds.

### duration

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.duration // 0
```

Returns **[number][258]** The duration in seconds.

### volume

Setter.

#### Parameters

-   `vol` **[number][258]** The volume to set in the range of 0-1.

Returns **void** 

### volume

Getter.

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.volume // 1
```

Returns **[number][258]** The current volume in the range of 0-1.

### paused

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.paused // false
```

Returns **[boolean][257]** Whether the cast player is in paused state.

### ended

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.ended // false
```

Returns **[boolean][257]** Whether the cast player is in ended state.

### seeking

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.seeking // false
```

Returns **[boolean][257]** Whether the cast player is in seeking state.

### muted

Setter.

#### Parameters

-   `mute` **[boolean][257]** The mute value to set.

Returns **void** 

### muted

Getter.

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.muted // false
```

Returns **[boolean][257]** The muted state.

### src

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.src // ''
```

Returns **[string][256]** The current playing source url.

### poster

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.poster // ''
```

Returns **[string][256]** The current poster url.

### playbackRate

Setter.

#### Parameters

-   `rate` **[number][258]** The playback rate to set.

Returns **void** 

### playbackRate

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.playbackRate // 1
```

Returns **[string][256]** The current playback rate.

### engineType

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.engineType // ''
```

Returns **[string][256]** The active engine type.

### streamType

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.streamType // ''
```

Returns **[string][256]** The active stream type.

### type

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.prototype.type // BaseRemotePlayer.Type
```

Returns **[string][256]** The remote player type.

### defaultConfig

Default configuration of the remote player.

Type: [Object][255]

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.defaultConfig // {}
```

### Type

Remote player type.

Type: [string][256]

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.Type // 'BaseRemotePlayer'
```

### isSupported

#### Examples

```javascript
BaseRemotePlayer.isSupported() // true
```

Returns **[boolean][257]** Whether the remote player is supported in the current environment.

## CastEventType

Type: [Object][255]

### Examples

```javascript
// Events lifecycle
1. CAST_AVAILABLE
2. CAST_SESSION_STARTING
3. CAST_SESSION_STARTED || CAST_SESSION_START_FAILED -> X
4. CAST_SESSION_ENDING
5. CAST_SESSION_ENDED
```

```javascript
// How to use
player.addEventListener(KalturaPlayer.cast.CastEventType.CAST_SESSION_STARTED, e => {
  console.log(e.session);
};
```

## RemoteControl

### Parameters

-   `player` **KalturaPlayer** The Kaltura player.

### getPlayerSnapshot

Type: [Function][266]

#### Parameters

## RemotePayload

### Parameters

## RemoteConnectedPayload

**Extends RemotePayload**

### Parameters

-   `player` **[BaseRemotePlayer][271]** The active remote player.
-   `session` **[RemoteSession][265]** The remote session.
-   `ui` **[RemotePlayerUI][272]?** Optional remote player UI preset.

### ui

Remote player UI preset.

Type: [RemotePlayerUI][272]?

Returns **[RemotePlayerUI][272]?** 

### session

Remote session.

Type: [RemoteSession][265]

Returns **[RemoteSession][265]?**

## RemotePlayerUI

### playbackUI

Playback UI of the remote player.

#### Parameters

-   `props` **[Object][255]** UI creation parameters.

Returns **React$Element&lt;any>** Component.

### idleUI

Idle UI of the remote player.

#### Parameters

-   `props` **[Object][255]** UI creation parameters.

Returns **React$Element&lt;any>** Component.

### adsUI

Idle UI of the remote player.

#### Parameters

-   `props` **[Object][255]** UI creation parameters.

Returns **React$Element&lt;any>** Component.

### liveUI

Live UI of the remote player.

#### Parameters

-   `props` **[Object][255]** UI creation parameters.

Returns **React$Element&lt;any>** Component.

### errorUI

Error UI of the remote player.

#### Parameters

-   `props` **[Object][255]** UI creation parameters.

Returns **React$Element&lt;any>** Component.

### uis

UI presets.

Type: [Array][261]&lt;UIPreset>

Returns **[Array][261]&lt;UIPreset>**

## RemoteSession

### Parameters

-   `id` **[string][256]** Session ID.
-   `friendlyName` **[string][256]** Receiver friendly name.
-   `resuming` **[boolean][257]?** Whether the session is resuming.

### deviceFriendlyName

Receiver friendly name.

Type: [string][256]

Returns **[string][256]** 

### id

Session ID.

Type: [string][256]

Returns **[string][256]** 

### resuming

Whether the session is resuming.

Type: [boolean][257]?

Returns **[boolean][257]?** 

## PlaylistEventType

Type: [Object][255]

### Examples

```javascript
// Events lifecycle
1. PLAYLIST_LOADED
2. PLAYLIST_ITEM_CHANGED (multiple)
3. PLAYLIST_ENDED
```

```javascript
// How to use
player.addEventListener(KalturaPlayer.playlist.PlaylistEventType.PLAYLIST_LOADED, e => {
  console.log(e.payload.playlist.metadata.name);
};
```

## PlaylistItem

### Parameters

-   `sources` **ProviderMediaConfigSourcesObject?** The item sources
-   `config` **[KPPlaylistItemConfigObject][273]?** The item config

### updateSources

Update the playlist item sources

#### Parameters

-   `sourcesObject` **ProviderMediaConfigSourcesObject** The sources

Returns **void** 

### sources

Playlist item sources

Type: ProviderMediaConfigSourcesObject?

Returns **ProviderMediaConfigSourcesObject?** 

### config

Playlist item config

Type: [KPPlaylistItemConfigObject][273]?

Returns **[KPPlaylistItemConfigObject][273]?** 

### isPlayable

Returns **[boolean][257]** = Whether the playlist item has sources to play

## PlaylistManager

### Parameters

-   `player` **KalturaPlayer** The player instance
-   `options` **KPOptionsObject** The player config object

### configure

Config the playlist

#### Parameters

-   `config` **KPPlaylistObject?** The playlist config
-   `entryList` **ProviderEntryListObject?** Entry list

Returns **void** 

### load

Load a playlist

#### Parameters

-   `playlistData` **KPPlaylistObject** The playlist data
-   `playlistConfig` **[KPPlaylistConfigObject][274]?** The playlist config
-   `entryList` **ProviderEntryListObject?** Entry list

Returns **void** 

### reset

Reset the playlist

Returns **void** 

### playNext

Play the next item

Returns **void** 

### playPrev

Play the previous item

Returns **void** 

### playItem

Play a specific item

#### Parameters

-   `index` **[number][258]** The index of the item to play

Returns **void** 

### items

Playlist items

Type: [Array][261]&lt;[PlaylistItem][262]>

Returns **[Array][261]&lt;[PlaylistItem][262]>** 

### next

Next item

Type: [PlaylistItem][262]?

Returns **[PlaylistItem][262]?** 

### prev

Previous item

Type: [PlaylistItem][262]?

Returns **[PlaylistItem][262]?** 

### id

Playlist id

Type: [string][256]

Returns **[string][256]** 

### metadata

Playlist metadata

Type: ProviderPlaylistMetadataObject

Returns **ProviderPlaylistMetadataObject** 

### poster

Playlist poster

Type: [string][256]?

Returns **[string][256]?** 

### countdown

Playlist countdown

Type: [KPPlaylistCountdownOptions][260]

Returns **[KPPlaylistCountdownOptions][260]** 

### options

Playlist options

Type: [KPPlaylistOptions][259]

Returns **[KPPlaylistOptions][259]** 

## getPlayers

get all instantiated players

Returns **[KalturaPlayers][275]** map of player ids and their respective instantiated player

## getPlayer

get a player instance by id

### Parameters

-   `id` **[string][256]** the player ID

Returns **(KalturaPlayer | null)** the player if found by the supplied ID or null if key doesn't exist
